definition: to multiply/to reproduce/to increase gradually in number or quantity
complicated/many/in great numbers/abbr. for 繁體|繁体[fan2 ti3], traditional form of Chinese characters
to spread out/to develop/to overflow/to amplify/superfluous

sentences.english: Living beings don’t create life, they re-purpose existing matter into offspring.
sentences.chinese: 众生不创造生命，他们用现有的东西重新繁衍后代。

sentences.english: One cannot imagine mere human beings concocting such dreadful things, and one can scarcely imagine human beings bearing life in them.
sentences.chinese: 更令人想不到的是，居然还有人类在其中繁衍生息。

sentences.english: In this case, prolongation of life should trump reproduction.
sentences.chinese: 既然这样，延长寿命就要重于繁衍后代。

sentences.english: Oasis is an optimum geographic section for multi-life-forms to live and propagate together in the desert region.
sentences.chinese: 绿洲是荒漠区适宜多种生物共同生息繁衍的地域。

sentences.english: They are more reproductively successful than unpaired females.
sentences.chinese: 和未配对的雌性相比，她们更能成功繁衍后代。

sentences.english: Do what Sarah says, because you shall have descendants through Isaac.
sentences.chinese: 因为你要靠以撒来繁衍后代。

sentences.english: Hepu gulf is of unique geographical position for pearl's growing.
sentences.chinese: 合浦沿海得天独厚的海湾是繁衍珍珠的最佳场所。

sentences.english: Chat, carry birds existence to multiply greatly development progress of history heavy responsibility also.
sentences.chinese: 聊天乎，担负鸟类生存繁衍发展进步之历史重任者也。

sentences.english: It reproduces with pine cones, which are the brown rough objects that are shaped like balls.
sentences.chinese: 它用咖啡色的球状的粗糙的松球繁衍。

sentences.english: When it comes to reproduction, men will still have it easier for some time.
sentences.chinese: 谈起繁衍来，男人还能优哉游哉一阵子。

sentences.english: Love is an appetite of generation by the mediation of beauty.
sentences.chinese: 爱情是以种以美作媒介的生命繁衍的欲望。

sentences.english: And if it is, why isn't plant breeding of any sort unnatural?
sentences.chinese: 如果是，为什么植物没有繁衍出任何非自然的植物呢？

sentences.english: And it's evolved due to survival and reproduction.
sentences.chinese: 它通过生存和繁衍进化。

sentences.english: How much of your personality and knowledge can be reproduced by a computer?
sentences.chinese: 一台计算机究竟能够繁衍你的多少个性和知识？

sentences.english: Balmford discussed some birds' abilities to prosper among humans.
sentences.chinese: 鲍姆福德探讨一些鸟类在人类环境成功繁衍的能力。

sentences.english: Only the achievement of sustainable development, can humanity multiply their off-springs.
sentences.chinese: 只有实现可持续发展，人类才能世代繁衍生息。

definition: population (of a species)/community (of animals or plants)
to inhabit a region (esp. ethnic group)/to congregate
to extinguish/to become extinct/to die out
to be pregnant/to produce offspring/to nurture (a development, school of thought, artwork etc)/fig. replete with (culture etc)
